intro: Putoria calabrica, commonly known as the Calabar puto, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of understory plant communities.
